0.title: I broke a few things in the dressing room: Akhtar on 2011 WC semi-final against India
0.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that he broke a few things in the dressing room after Pakistan lost the 2011 World Cup semi-final against India in Mohali. "Mohali memory haunts me...They should have played me, they should have. It was completely unfair from the team management," said Akhtar, who had missed the match due to an injury.

1.title: UP CM's advisor posts bulldozer pic after violence, says 'Every Friday followed by Saturday'
1.article_body: A day after violence and protests erupted in several states over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma, UP CM Yogi Adityanath's media advisor Mrityunjay Kumar shared a picture of a bulldozer. "Rioters must remember, every Friday is followed by a Saturday," he wrote. The protests broke out after Friday prayers.

2.title: UN adopts resolution on multilingualism that mentions Hindi for the 1st time
2.article_body: The United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) has adopted an India-sponsored resolution on multilingualism that mentions the Hindi language for the first time. The resolution encourages the UN to continue disseminating important communications and messages in official as well as in non-official languages, including in Hindi language. The resolution also mentions Bangla and Urdu for the first time.

3.title: US to lift COVID testing requirement for international air travellers
3.article_body: From June 12, the US will no longer require international air travellers to have proof of a negative COVID-19 test before entering the country. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) will re-evaluate the decision in 90 days and the testing requirement could be reinstated if a troubling new variant emerges, a US government official said.

4.title: BJP's sin, why should people suffer: Mamata Banerjee on violence in Howrah
4.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee blamed BJP for violence in Howrah over comments made on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson and said, "[It's] BJP's sin, why should people suffer?" "There are some political parties behind what is happening in Howrah. They want to cause riots but this will not be tolerated. Strict action will be taken," she tweeted.

5.title: South Africa series is a good opportunity to express myself: Hardik Pandya
5.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that the ongoing T20I series against South Africa is a "good opportunity to express" himself. "My roles will change here. I won't be the captain and I won't be batting higher up the order. This will be back to what I've been known for," Pandya said.

6.title: Time for Tom Latham to take over captaincy of NZ Test side: Simon Doull
6.article_body: Former New Zealand pacer Simon Doull has said that it's almost time for Kiwi batter Tom Latham to "take over the Test side". "He's (Latham) a terrific captain. I think he reads the game really well...If Kane Williamson is fit for the last Test and captains New Zealand, might it be for the last time in Test cricket?" Doull asked.

7.title: Pune district reported 5 malaria cases until May 31 this year: Data
7.article_body: Pune district has reported five cases of malaria until May 31 this year, according to official data. Speaking about efforts to curb the spread of malaria, Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad said, "We hope to keep up the outcome through prevention, early detection and proper treatment." Notably, no lives were lost to the disease this year.

8.title: Pak won't get such pitches in Australia: Inzamam on pitches for WI series
8.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said Pakistan won't get pitches similar to the ones seen in the ongoing home series against West Indies, when they will go to Australia for the T20 World Cup 2022. Ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt had earlier stated that pitches prepared by Pakistan at home take everything away from a captain in terms of "strategy".

9.title: Muhammad Nawaz was outstanding with the ball: Babar Azam
9.article_body: After Pakistan registered a victory by 120 runs against the West Indies on Friday, skipper Babar Azam praised spinner Muhammad Nawaz for his four-wicket haul. "Nawaz was outstanding, he picked wickets at crucial moments. We were under pressure after the first 10 overs but really happy with the way we fought back," Azam said.

10.title: BJP's victory in Rajya Sabha polls through 'horse-trading': Sanjay Raut
10.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday claimed that the Bharatiya Janata Party secured Rajya Sabha seats in the recent elections in Maharashtra through horse-trading. "The victory [of BJP] was not a mandate," he said. Raut also said that the poll results don't pose any threat to the ruling coalition government of Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi (MVA).

11.title: Rishi & I'd broken up during 'Parda...' shoot, we used to fight a lot: Neetu
11.article_body: Neetu Kapoor recently revealed that she had broken up with Rishi Kapoor during the shoot of their song 'Parda Hai Parda'. "Rishi Ji and I were at loggerheads at the time of...song's shoot. We used to fight a lot," she said, adding, "It was...romantic song where I'd to throw a rose...but what was going in my mind was something else."

12.title: Shreyas has to improve his game against fast bowlers: Jaffer
12.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India batter Shreyas Iyer needs to improve his game against the fast bowlers. "He's batting in the top four, he isn't somebody who comes at the backend...that innings [against South Africa] could've been a little bit better," he added. Batting at number three, Shreyas scored a 27-ball 36 in first T20I against South Africa.

13.title: K'taka govt issues ordinance to reserve 1/3rd BBMP seats for OBCs
13.article_body: The Karnataka government has issued an ordinance for reserving one-third of the seats of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) council for Other Backward Classes (OBCs). The civic polls, which are pending since 2020, were delayed amid the ward delimitation process by the state government. The total reservation for OBCs and ST/SCs will remain under 50%, the ordinance states.

14.title: Chhattisgarh boy falls into 80-ft borewell, rescue op underway
14.article_body: An 11-year-old boy fell into an 80-foot-deep abandoned borewell at a village in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir-Champa district on Friday, an official said. National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) teams have been deployed to carry out the rescue operation. JCB excavators are reportedly being used to dig a parallel pit to rescue the child.

15.title: Russia using anti-ship missiles on land targets in Ukraine: UK
15.article_body: Russia is running short of more precise modern missiles and is using 1960s-era Kh-22 anti-ship missiles meant to destroy aircraft carriers with nuclear warheads against land targets in Ukraine, the UK Defence Ministry said. These 5.5-tonne Kh-22 missiles, when used in ground attacks with conventional warheads, are highly inaccurate and can cause severe collateral damage and casualties, it added.

16.title: Had OTT existed earlier, I wouldn't have to wait for 47 years: Pankaj
16.article_body: Pankaj Tripathi, while speaking about the significance of OTT, said he would have grown very early in his career had OTT existed at that time. "Wouldn't have had to wait for 47 years," Pankaj said. He further stated that with OTT, even side actors get recognition as there is enough time. "The struggle for actors has definitely reduced," Pankaj added.

17.title: How did Congress leader Ajay Maken lose in Haryana Rajya Sabha polls?
17.article_body: Eighty-eight votes were cast in Haryana Rajya Sabha polls. BJP's Krishan Panwar received 36, Congress' Ajay Maken got 29 and Independent candidate Kartikeya Sharma got 23. A candidate needed 29.34 votes to win. After Panwar won in first round, his excess votes 6.66 (36-29.34) were transferred to BJP-backed Sharma. Sharma's tally increased to 29.66, while Maken remained at 29.

18.title: Woman can't be forced to go outside & work just because she's a graduate: Bombay HC
18.article_body: A woman cannot be compelled to go to work merely because she's a graduate, the Bombay HC has said. "Our society hasn't yet accepted the woman...should contribute (towards household finances)," said Justice Bharati Dangre, adding that "it's a woman's choice to work" or "sit at home". HC was hearing a man's plea against paying maintenance to his estranged wife.

19.title: Putin carries poop case when he travels outside Moscow to hide health problems: Report
19.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin carries a suitcase filled with his own excrement and urine when he travels outside Moscow, as per reports. "Putin fears possibility of...information about his health getting into...hands of foreign intelligence services," a former DIA intelligence officer told Fox News. A report said Putin has a special aide from Federal Guard Service who handles the suitcase.

20.title: Sanjay, Mahesh & I did 'Kurukshetra' & strangely all of us got cancer: Mahima
20.article_body: Mahima Chaudhry, speaking about her battle with cancer, said, "Sanjay Dutt, Mahesh Manjrekar and I...did [film] 'Kurukshetra', and strangely, all of us had to battle cancer around...same time." While Sanjay was diagnosed with lung cancer, Mahesh was diagnosed with urinary bladder cancer. Mahima said stories of celebrities like Sanjay Dutt and Sonali Bendre inspired her during her cancer treatment.

21.title: Nadal winning French Open with a dead foot is outrageous: Ex-world no. 1
21.article_body: Ex-world number one doubles player Rennae Stubbs said watching Rafael Nadal win the French Open 2022 with a dead foot is "just outrageous". "I knew that he would be hitting that foot out with as much painkiller and anaesthetic that he could, to be able to operate on the tennis court and run," added Stubbs. "It's just unbelievable," stated Stubbs.

22.title: Indian women's boxing squad for CWG 2022 announced as Mary Kom ruled out due to injury
22.article_body: The Boxing Federation of India announced the Indian women's boxing squad for CWG 2022 following trials in Delhi. Nitu will represent India in 48-kg category, while Nikhat Zareen will feature in 50-kg category. Jaismine (60 kg) and Olympic bronze medallist Lovlina Borgohain (70 kg) have also been included. Notably, Mary Kom was ruled out of CWG 2022 due to injury.

23.title: Oil tanker falls off bridge, explodes in Odisha; 4 charred to death
23.article_body: At least four people were charred to death and one suffered serious injuries after an oil tanker fell off a bridge into a river and exploded in Odisha's Nayagarh, police said on Saturday. The oil tanker had hit the bridge's crash barrier after the driver lost control. Two of the deceased were people who'd gone to rescue driver and helper.

24.title: Prayagraj violence mastermind detained, police say 'kids were used to hurl stones'
24.article_body: The mastermind behind Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj violence on Friday, identified as Javed Ahmed, has been detained, Prayagraj SSP said. "There could be more masterminds...The anti-social elements used minor kids to hurl stones at police and administration," he added. Protests broke out in Prayagraj over former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

25.title: I couldn't become an actor so became one via teaching: PhysicsWallah's Founder
25.article_body: Edtech startup PhysicsWallah recently became India's 101st unicorn. Founder Alakh Pandey, a Prayagraj-based teacher who started PhysicsWallah as a YouTube channel in 2016 with an investment of about ₹30,000, said, "I couldn't become an actor, so I became an actor through teaching...I can showcase my whole acting talent through teaching. So I get that enjoyment as well."

26.title: Quit and find a firm you believe in: Coinbase CEO as staff seeks to remove execs
26.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong tweeted, "Quit and find a company to work at that you believe in," after an employee petition sought the removal of three top executives at the crypto exchange. He said that posting the petition in public was "deeply unethical". Armstrong further said, "It's also dumb because if you get caught you will be fired."

27.title: Fire breaks out at thermocol factory in Rajasthan's Dausa
27.article_body: A fire broke out at a polystyrene (thermocol) factory located in the Mahuwa area of Rajasthan's Dausa district on Saturday. According to reports, around 5-6 labourers are still trapped inside the factory and 25 fire brigades are being used for the rescue operation. "The fire broke out in the morning, and efforts are underway to douse the flames," police said.

28.title: FIR filed after protests outside Delhi's Jama Masjid over remarks on Prophet
28.article_body: Delhi Police filed FIR under section 188 of IPC after protests outside Jama Masjid against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. "Around 1,500 people had gathered at the mosque for Friday prayers. When the prayers ended peacefully, some people came outside, started showing placards...others also joined them...numbers went up to around 300," police said.

29.title: China is becoming more coercive & aggressive: US Defence Secretary
29.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said America will do its part to manage tensions with China "responsibly" and prevent conflict even though Beijing is becoming more "aggressive" and "coercive" in the Asian region, including near Taiwan. He also said there's an "alarming" increase in the number of unsafe, unprofessional encounters between Chinese planes and vessels with those of other nations.

30.title: Inflation in US hits 8.6% in May, highest in 40 years
30.article_body: Amid rising prices of gas, food and other goods, inflation in the US hit a 40-year high of 8.6% in May. On a month-to-month basis, prices jumped 1% from April to May, faster than the 0.3% increase from March to April. Food prices were up more than 10% last month compared to May 2021, while energy surged more than 34%.

31.title: Visit Moosewala's parents 2-4 times a yr: Gippy Grewal urges artists
31.article_body: Singer Gippy Grewal, on the birth anniversary of late singer Sidhu Moosewala, penned a post for fellow artists of the Punjabi music industry. While sharing pictures with Moosewala, Grewal urged artists to visit his parents at least two to four times a year. "We should become like their son...and offer them love," Grewal said while urging artists to stay united.

32.title: Monsoon has arrived over Mumbai: IMD
32.article_body: The IMD on Saturday declared the arrival of southwest monsoon over Mumbai. "Conditions are favourable for further advance of monsoon into some parts of north Arabian sea, remaining parts of Konkan, some parts of Gujarat state, most parts of Madhya Maharashtra, entire Karnataka and Tamil Nadu, some parts of Telangana, Andhra Pradesh...during next 48 hours," IMD said.

33.title: Prez Kovind to inaugurate an ISKCON temple in Bengaluru on June 14
33.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will inaugurate the Rajadhiraja Sri Govinda Temple of ISKCON in Bengaluru on June 14. The state's Governor, Chief Minister and other dignitaries will also participate in the event. The temple, which is a replica of the Sri Venkateshwara Temple in Tirumala, will have facilities for the spiritual and cultural education of children and families.

34.title: Man kills wife after quarrel over his liquor consumption in Pune
34.article_body: A 32-year-old engineer was arrested after he allegedly thrashed his 30-year-old wife to death following a quarrel over his liquor consumption in Pune, the police said. The incident took place on June 9 around 10.30 pm, while the couple's three-year-old daughter was at home, a sub-inspector said. An FIR was filed in the matter by the deceased's father on Friday.

35.title: IED recovered on Srinagar-Baramulla highway, traffic suspended
35.article_body: Traffic was suspended on the Srinagar-Baramulla highway in Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday after the security forces recovered an improvised explosive device (IED) near the highway. "The IED was recovered in Putkha area of Sangrama in Baramulla district by five Rashtriya Rifles and the J&K Police," police said. "Efforts are on to defuse the IED," they added.

36.title: Very concerning: Canada after China harasses its patrol aircraft near North Korea
36.article_body: Canada has said China showed "very concerning and unprofessional" behaviour while harassing its patrol aircraft near North Korea. Canadian military had said China forced its planes to divert from flight paths as they monitored North Korea sanction evasions. Meanwhile, China said Canada stepped up provocations against the country under the pretext of implementing UN Security Council resolutions.

37.title: Don't want it to be crap: Hamilton on not appearing in Pitt's film on F1
37.article_body: Seven-time Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton said he will not appear in an upcoming untitled film on F1 starring Brad Pitt which Hamilton will be co-producing, as he doesn't want the movie to be "crap". "My responsibility...is...making sure...the cast and the crew...is diverse," added Hamilton. "We are...spending good time with Brad which is pretty epic," stated Hamilton.

38.title: Jharkhand CM appeals for peace amid violence in state over Prophet row
38.article_body: Amid the ongoing violence over the Prophet row in Jharkhand's Ranchi where two people have been killed, CM Hemant Soren has appealed to the public to maintain peace. "I suddenly received information about this worrisome (protest) incident...public of Jharkhand has always been very sensitive and tolerant...no need to panic. I appeal to everyone to maintain harmony," CM Soren said.

39.title: Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak joins Salman in 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
39.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari has joined the cast of Salman Khan's upcoming movie 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. "Palak has been handpicked by Salman himself. She will be seen opposite Jassie (Gill) and has an amazing track in the film. She has joined the shoot," reports stated. The film, directed by Farhad Samji, also stars Pooja Hegde.

40.title: K'taka police open fire as 2 murder accused try to escape; 5 hurt
40.article_body: Two men who're accused of murder and three police personnel were injured after police opened fire at the accused when they tried to escape in Karnataka's Mangaluru. Out of three rounds of fire, one was shot in air and two at the accused, the city's Police Commissioner N Shashi Kumar said. The duo suffered injuries to their legs, he added.

41.title: Google Maps rolls out new feature to check Air Quality Index of a locality
41.article_body: Google Maps has rolled out a new feature that will show the Air Quality Index of an area on both Android and iOS devices. In India, Google is sourcing data from the Central Pollution Control Board, as well as State Pollution Control Board. The Air Quality feature can be accessed on the app through the layer settings option.

42.title: Intent was there to be bit more aggressive: Conway on NZ innings in 2nd Test
42.article_body: After New Zealand posted 318/4 on Day 1 of the second Test against England, Kiwi batter Devon Conway spoke about the team's aggressive intent. "We spoke about in our batting meetings between Tests was to try and be a bit more aggressive," Conway said. He added, "We were probably lacking that a bit in the first Test."

43.title: Zelenskyy didn't want to hear warnings about Russian invasion: Biden
43.article_body: US President Joe Biden said that his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy "didn't want to hear" American intelligence warnings that indicated Russia was about to invade his country. Biden added that he knew "a lot of people thought he was exaggerating" when he said reports had revealed Russian President Vladimir Putin "was going to go in, off the border".

44.title: 16-yr-old Praggnanandhaa wins chess title in Norway
44.article_body: Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa won the Norway Chess Group A open chess tournament. The 16-year-old chess champion remained unbeaten through the nine rounds and finished with 7.5 points. Notably, Praggnanandhaa (Elo 2642) finished a full point ahead of second-placed players. "He was the top seed, so it is not a surprise that he won the tournament," coach RB Ramesh said.

45.title: 8 killed, 2 rescued as vehicle falls into pond in Bihar's Purnia
45.article_body: As many as eight people were killed on Saturday after the vehicle they were travelling in fell into a pond in Kanjia village of Bihar's Purnia district, police said. "They were coming from Tarabadi and going to Kishanganj when it happened. Two people were safely rescued. Bodies...sent for postmortem," police added. The driver lost control over the vehicle, police stated.

46.title: Huawei India CEO, 3 other execs summoned by Delhi court in IT case
46.article_body: A Delhi court has summoned Huawei India CEO Li Xiongwei and three other executives in a complaint filed by the Income Tax Department accusing them of withholding sought information. "The non-compliance...had resulted in obstruction and stifling of search action of...officers," the court said. The court observed that the officials "deliberately chose to give vague answers" to IT officials.

47.title: Redeveloping 500 km Delhi roads with European standards: CM Kejriwal
47.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal held a meeting with Denmark's Ambassador to India HE Freddy Svane to discuss air pollution, groundwater recharge and the development of world-class road infrastructure on Friday. "We are redeveloping 500 km of Delhi's roads on a par with European standards," he said. "We can collaborate with Denmark on the road beautification project if required," Kejriwal added.

48.title: Desilting of drains to be complete by June 15; 96% work done: MCD
48.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi is likely to finish the work on the desilting of drains by June 15. The MCD claimed that the work is underway on "war-footing" and the corporation has completed 96% of the total work so far. Notably, so far, MCD has removed more than 87,000 metric tonnes of silt from 688 drains.

49.title: Video of brawl between fans in stands during India-SA T20I in Delhi surfaces
49.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a section of spectators fighting in the stands during India-South Africa T20I in Delhi. Security officials had to intervene to stop the fight. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Just a normal seen in Kotla East stand." The reason behind the fist fight is not known.

50.title: Woman reunited with son switched at birth 3 yrs ago at Assam hospital
50.article_body: Following a court directive, a woman was reunited with her son three years after he was switched at birth at a government-run hospital in Assam's Barpeta. The incident had occurred due to the similarity between the names of the two women. The two women had both given birth at the hospital, however, one of the infants was stillborn.

51.title: Navi Mumbai Traffic Police destroy 82 high-volume modified silencers
51.article_body: Navi Mumbai Traffic Police on Friday cracked down on two-wheelers having modified high-volume silencers and seized 82 silencers. Following a special drive by Seawoods traffic branch, the silencers were crushed in front of civic headquarters in Belapur. "Strict action will also be taken against garage owners who install such silencers," said Deputy Police Commissioner (Traffic) Purushottam Karad.

52.title: Radio station owned by 'Putin's favourite oligarch' hacked to play Ukrainian anthem
52.article_body: A Russian radio station was hacked and the Ukrainian anthem and anti-war songs were played instead of its news broadcast. Kommersant FM is owned by the Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov, the fifth richest person in Russia, whom the European Union described as "one of Russian President Vladimir Putin's favourite oligarchs."

53.title: Pakistan penalised 5 runs against West Indies due to illegal fielding
53.article_body: Pakistan were penalised five runs against West Indies in second ODI after illegal fielding by Babar Azam. The Pakistan captain was spotted to have picked up a wicketkeeping glove from Muhammad Rizwan and used it to collect a throw behind stumps. As per rules, no fielder other than the wicketkeeper shall be permitted to wear gloves or external leg guards.

54.title: US woman who caught STD from partner in his car to get ₹40 crore from insurance firm
54.article_body: A US woman was awarded $5.2 million (over ₹40 crore) in a settlement from an insurance company after contracting a sexually transmitted disease (STD) from her partner in his vehicle, which was insured by the company. The woman from Missouri said she contracted human papillomavirus (HPV) from her partner, according to court documents.

55.title: Hardik will be India's game-changer in every single match: Gavaskar
55.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Hardik Pandya, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said," He...[will] be the game-changer for India...in all the matches that are due to come, not just the World Cup but every single match." Gavaskar added that Hardik will be India's game-changer whether he bats at number five, whether he comes to bowl "at first change or second change".

56.title: India's space mission biggest recognition of Aatmanirbhar Bharat: PM Modi
56.article_body: Addressing the inauguration of IN-SPACe in Ahmedabad's Bopal, Prime Minister Narendra Modi called India's space mission the biggest recognition of the Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative. "IN-SPACe will give a platform to the youth of India and the best scientific minds of the country to showcase their talent," he said. "IN-SPACe has the potential to revolutionise India's space industry," the PM added.

57.title: Want to be number one & will reach that goal: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
57.article_body: Kartik Aaryan in an interview said, "With...success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', reading...[headlines] like 'Rise of a Superstar' or 'Era of Kartik Aaryan' makes me proud, but they also ground me." "It's a long journey, so I've to update myself. I want to be number one...I'll reach that goal," he added. The film has earned ₹163.15 crore in India so far.

58.title: Not shocked by Maharashtra RS poll results: Sharad Pawar
58.article_body: After BJP won three Rajya Sabha seats from Maharashtra on Friday, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar has said that the results haven't come as "shocking" to him. "I am not shocked to see the results...(MVA) received the votes as per the quota," Pawar said. "Only Praful Patel (of NCP) received one extra vote...it was from the opposite side," he added.

59.title: Maharashtra to launch ₹200 cr women-focussed fund for startups
59.article_body: Maharashtra will set up a ₹200-crore fund to invest in early-stage deep tech startups from the state, with a focus on women-led and socially relevant startups. It's also planning to launch a seed fund for startups, Manisha Verma, IAS, Principal Secretary of Maharashtra State Innovation Society, said. Maharashtra already has several investment vehicles to make equity investments in startups.

60.title: 4 arrested for stealing 185 mobile phones from shop in Greater Noida
60.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police have arrested four people for stealing 185 mobile phones worth ₹20 lakh from a shop at Kasna in Greater Noida. The accused have been identified as Anand, Hira, Ghanshyam Lal and Sanjeev. Notably, the incident was reported on May 21 when the accused, who worked at nearby shops, entered the shop by cutting its shutter.

61.title: Syria halts flights to & from Damascus after Israeli attack
61.article_body: Syria has halted all flights to and from Damascus International Airport "until further notice" after Israeli airstrikes on Friday damaged the airstrip and a terminal, the Transport Ministry said. One civilian was injured in the attack, state news agency SANA said. According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, the airstrikes were targeting "warehouses of Iranian militias" near the airport.

62.title: Sec 144 in Howrah's Uluberia-Sub Division extended till June 15 after violent protests
62.article_body: Section 144 CrPC imposed in and around the stretches of national highways and railway stations under the jurisdiction of Howrah's Uluberia-Sub Division in West Bengal has been extended till June 15. Violent protests broke out on Friday over former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. A BJP office was set on fire in Howrah.

63.title: Fire breaks out at hospital ICU in Delhi's Rohini, patient feared dead
63.article_body: A fire broke out at the ICU of Brahm Shakti Hospital in Delhi's Rohini on Saturday, officials said. A patient, believed to be around 64 years old, is feared to have died. The fire was reported around 4:50 am on the third floor, officials added. The fire broke out apparently due to a short circuit, DCP Rohini said.

64.title: Sunny Deol, Sanjay, Jackie & Mithun team up for 'desi Expendables': Report
64.article_body: Mithun Chakraborty, Sunny Deol, Sanjay Dutt and Jackie Shroff are reportedly teaming up for an action film, which will be directed by Vivek Chauhan. "It's more of...desi Expendables, as all...four men are historically known for having an action image," a source told Pinkvilla. 'The Expendables', which was released in 2010, featured Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham and Steve Austin, among others.

65.title: Avesh Khan put me under a lot of pressure: Van der Dussen on 75*(46)
65.article_body: Discussing his 75* off 46 balls in South Africa's win against India by seven wickets in the first T20I, Rassie van der Dussen said, "Avesh Khan put me under a lot of pressure." "[He] didn't miss his mark," added Van der Dussen. Talking about being dropped by Shreyas Iyer, the batter stated he knew he had to make India "pay".

66.title: BJP MP urges Amit Shah to deploy central forces in Bengal amid protests
66.article_body: BJP MP Saumitra Khan on Saturday urged Home Minister Amit Shah to deploy central forces in West Bengal amid protests. "To keep the people of Bengal safe, you (Amit Shah) should appoint a central force...and entrust the security of West Bengal to them," Khan wrote in his letter. Notably, internet services were suspended in Howrah following protests on Friday evening.

67.title: Pakistan's Shadab Khan hugs pitch invader after he salutes him, pics go viral
67.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan hugged a pitch invader after the latter saluted him during the second ODI against West Indies in Multan on Friday. The fan invaded the ground and saluted Shadab, who was batting at the striker's end. The pitch invader then left the ground himself without the security having to escort him.

68.title: Inter-state robbery gang busted in Hyd, valuables worth over ₹26 lakh seized
68.article_body: Hyderabad's Gopalapuram Police on Friday busted an inter-state robbery gang and apprehended six members in connection with the same. Valuables worth over ₹26 lakh, including cash, gold and silver ornaments, were also seized from the accused, police said. The gang used to travel by RTC or private buses posing as passengers and steal valuables from fellow passengers, police added.

69.title: Man falls while trying to board running train in Chennai, saved
69.article_body: Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) Chennai on Friday shared a video of RPF constable, Ram Kisan Meena, saving a man after he fell into the gap between the platform and train while trying to board the train. The video shows the passenger purportedly losing balance while attempting to board the moving train. The DRM also commended Meena for his "brave act".

70.title: I have given all my money to my father, told him to keep me away from it: MI's Tilak
70.article_body: Mumbai Indians' (MI) 19-year-old batting all-rounder Tilak Varma, who was the second-highest run-scorer for the franchise in IPL 2022, said, "I have given it all to my father and told him to keep me away from it." He added, "I know it is too easy to get distracted." Tilak was bought by MI for ₹1.7 crore in the mega auction.

71.title: Kashmiri YouTuber who posted video depicting beheading of ex-BJP leader apologises
71.article_body: Kashmiri YouTuber Faisal Wani who posted a video depicting beheading of ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma after her remarks on Prophet Muhammad has apologised. "I apologise. I'm extremely sorry if it hurt anyone," he said. Many social media users reported the video to J&K Police urging them to take action against Wani, who later deleted the video.

72.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, traffic jams in Pune
72.article_body: Pune on Friday witnessed heavy rainfall leading to traffic jams and waterlogging across the district. Around 30 tree-felling incidents were reported and a wall collapsed on Karve Road damaging 11 vehicles, an official added. Two people on two-wheelers also narrowly escape after they fell into a manhole, opened by PMC officials due to waterlogging, and were rescued by commuters.

73.title: Lots of outside edges, played down the wrong line: Gavaskar on Ishan's 76
73.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said India opener Ishan Kishan, who was the top-scorer in the first T20I against South Africa with 76(48), did not have a smooth start to his innings with a "lot" of outside edges. "Ishan was playing down the wrong line," added Gavaskar. Ishan's 76 comprised 11 fours and three sixes. He scored at a strike rate of 158.33.

74.title: 2 constables booked for beating up man over accident in Meerut
74.article_body: Two constables, who allegedly beat up a man after his tempo hit their motorcycle in Meerut on June 6, were booked on Friday. He had submitted a written complaint at Ganganagar Police Station where the station in-charge allegedly refused to file FIR. They were booked after BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik reportedly threatened to protest if police didn't file an FIR.

75.title: Indian diplomat Amandeep Singh Gill appointed as UN chief's Envoy on Technology
75.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has appointed senior Indian diplomat Amandeep Singh Gill as his Envoy on Technology to coordinate programmes for international digital cooperation. As per the UN, Gill has a "deep knowledge of digital technologies along with a solid understanding of how to leverage the digital transformation responsibly". Gill joined the Indian Foreign Service in 1992.

76.title: Czech police seize 840 kg of cocaine hidden in banana shipment
76.article_body: The Czech Republic Police on Friday seized 840 kilograms (1,852 pounds) of cocaine among bananas delivered to several supermarkets. The street value of the drug is estimated to be more than 2 billion Czech crowns (around $86 million). "The information about the shipment leads outside the Czech Republic, therefore we will use international police and justice cooperation," the police said.

77.title: Hrithik Roshan announces wrap on 'Vikram Vedha', shares pic from set
77.article_body: Hrithik Roshan took to his social media handles on Friday to announce that shooting of the film 'Vikram Vedha' has been completed. He also shared pictures with director duo Gayatri and Pushkar, and with co-star Saif Ali Khan. "Becoming Vedha, good or bad, wouldn't have been possible without the powerful presence of Saif as Vikram," Hrithik wrote alongside the pictures.

78.title: No conclusive evidence yet on SARS-CoV-2 origin: WHO
78.article_body: WHO on Thursday said there's no conclusive evidence to confirm the lab leak theory of SARS-CoV-2 yet. "Wuhan strain of SARS-CoV-2 has animal origin...the genetically related viruses are beta coronaviruses found in Rhinolophus bats in China and Laos," Dr Raman Gangakhedkar said. "We don't know anything about...the intermediate host - from bats to where before transmitting to humans," he added.

79.title: Pant will look back at not using Chahal's 4 overs: Zaheer on 1st T20I
79.article_body: Zaheer Khan said India's stand-in captain Rishabh Pant will look back at his decision to not give Yuzvendra Chahal four overs to bowl in the first T20I against South Africa. "[The] team management will have conversations around [it]," added Zaheer. "Chahal could have created an opportunity...The game would have been different," he stated. South Africa beat India by seven wickets.

80.title: AR Rahman hosts wedding reception for his daughter in Chennai, pics surface
80.article_body: Oscar-winning music composer AR Rahman on Friday hosted a wedding reception for his daughter Khatija Rahman, who got married to live sound engineer Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed last month. Pictures from the reception in Chennai have surfaced online. The reception was attended by Yo Yo Honey Singh, Manisha Koirala and Sonu Nigam among others.

81.title: 2 men, who stopped on Mumbai's sea link to save bird, killed after being hit by taxi
81.article_body: A businessman and his driver, who got down from their car to save an injured bird on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link, died after being hit by a taxi on May 30, police said. The incident was caught on camera. A case was registered against the taxi driver for rash and negligent driving and he was arrested, police added.

82.title: 2 dead in Ranchi after violent protests over remarks on Prophet; internet suspended
82.article_body: Two people died and 10 others were injured in violent protests in Jharkhand's Ranchi over former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. "One jawan also suffered bullet injuries...is being treated," police said. Ranchi district administration suspended internet services till tomorrow morning and Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in 12 police station areas.

83.title: Tesla seeks investor nod for 3-for-1 stock split to make shares more affordable
83.article_body: Tesla on Friday proposed to its shareholders to approve a three-for-one stock split in order to make its shares cheaper for buyers. Tesla shares have fallen nearly 40% since CEO Elon Musk unveiled his stake in Twitter in April. If the shareholders approve Tesla's proposal, it would be the company's first such action after a five-for-one split in August 2020.

84.title: Ukraine today may be East Asia tomorrow: Japanese PM
84.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida warned that "Ukraine today may be East Asia tomorrow" amid growing concerns that China could invade Taiwan. US officials believe that China is closely monitoring how Russia's invasion of Ukraine progresses to assess their own plans when it comes to Taiwan. Last month, US President Joe Biden said America would intervene militarily if China invaded Taiwan.

85.title: K'taka college students clash over Savarkar portrait in classroom
85.article_body: Two groups of college students clashed on Friday at a constituent institute of Mangalore University in Karnataka over a portrait of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar being put up in a classroom. The portrait had been removed by the college earlier as it was mounted without permission, the institute's principal said. Some students were admitted to a hospital, a police officer said.

86.title: Election Commission favoured BJP: Sanjay Raut on Maharashtra RS polls
86.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday alleged that the Election Commission (EC) favoured BJP in the Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections held on Friday. "EC made our one vote invalid. We objected to two votes, but no action was taken on that," Raut claimed. His reaction came after EC rejected the vote cast by Shiv Sena legislator Suhas Kande.

87.title: BJP's Krishan Lal Panwar, BJP-JJP backed Kartikeya Sharma win in Haryana RS polls
87.article_body: BJP's Krishan Lal Panwar and BJP-Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) backed Kartikeya Sharma won two Rajya Sabha seats in Haryana that went to polls on Friday. "Their success is a victory of democracy...best wishes to them for their new responsibilities in the development of our great nation," Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar tweeted. Congress' Ajay Maken lost the election.

88.title: Indian economy rebounded strongly despite 3 COVID-19 waves: US Treasury report
88.article_body: The US Treasury in its report to Congress stated that the Indian economy rebounded strongly despite three COVID-19 waves. It praised India's COVID-19 vaccination drive and said that the government continued to provide fiscal support to the economy amid the pandemic in 2021. Despite the Omicron outbreak in 2022, economic fallout was limited in India, it added.

89.title: Football owes it to Messi: Man City's Alvarez on FIFA World Cup 2022
89.article_body: Manchester City's Julián Alvarez said football "owes" the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar to Argentina forward Lionel Messi considering "everything he means for football worldwide". "It would be very nice if it could be achieved," added Alvarez. Argentina have been placed along with Poland, Mexico, Saudi Arabia in Group C. Messi won his first ever international trophy in 2021.

90.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash, husband Nithin Raju blessed with a baby girl
90.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash and her husband Nithin Raju have been blessed with a baby girl. She took to Instagram on Friday to make the announcement. Pranitha also shared pictures of herself from the hospital with her newborn and wrote, "The last few days have been surreal...ever since our baby girl was born." Several celebrities posted congratulatory comments on the post.

91.title: Dutch government not to sell land to Facebook-parent Meta
91.article_body: The Dutch government will not yet sell land in the city of Zeewolde to Facebook-parent Meta,  ANP reported quoting the country's housing minister. Hugo de Jonge said that the company had not met the conditions to use the land. In March, Meta suspended plans to build a giant data centre in the Netherlands, following political opposition.

92.title: President Kovind pays obeisance at Mata Vaishno Devi shrine with family
92.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind visited the shrine of Shri Mata Vaishno Devi in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra with wife Savita Kovind and daughter Swati on Friday. "The President prayed for peace and prosperity in the country," an official said. Followed by this, he also visited Bhairon Ghati to pay obeisance at the Bhairon Baba Temple.

93.title: 45 stolen two-wheelers recovered in Pune, 4 arrested
93.article_body: The Pune Rural Police have busted a gang of inter-state vehicle thieves and have recovered 45 stolen two-wheelers from their possession. The accused are identified as Pramod Lakshman Sarkunde (26), Dnyaneshwar Ranganath Bibve (22), Ganesh Fakkad Karkhile (23) and Adil Qureshi (21). Notably, 34 crimes registered at various police stations have been solved with the accused's arrest, police said.

94.title: I have performed there, I couldn't breathe: Arjun Kanungo on venue of KK's last concert
94.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo has revealed that he had once performed at the Kolkata venue where KK performed before passing away aged 53. "I did hear the auditorium was extremely hot. I have performed [there] before...I couldn't breathe...It was so hot, the ACs weren't working," he said. Kanungo added, "These older auditoriums are not maintained well. It’s a multi-varied problem."

95.title: Six lands directly into spectator's beer glass during England-NZ Test, video goes viral
95.article_body: A video went viral showing New Zealand batter Daryl Mitchell's six landing directly into a spectator's beer glass on Day 1 of second England-New Zealand Test at Trent Bridge. Reacting to it, commentator Nasser Hussain said, "What does the local beer do to Duke's ball do we know?" The woman was later given a replacement pint by New Zealand team.

96.title: India sees its highest daily COVID-19 cases in over 3 months as 8,329 test positive
96.article_body: India saw 8,329 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This is the highest daily tally in over 3 months. Active cases in the country have crossed the 40,000-mark, while the COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,24,757.

97.title: Punjab minister sits on SUV's roof, policemen seen out of windows; video surfaces
97.article_body: A video showing Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Singh Bhullar sitting on his SUV's roof and his security personnel out of windows has surfaced on social media. Admitting his mistake, Bhullar apologised and said, "The video was made around three months ago when I was declared elected on day of counting of the votes."

98.title: Revlon shares post biggest one-day drop on reports of firm nearing bankruptcy filing
98.article_body: New York-based cosmetics company Revlon is preparing to file for bankruptcy next week amid its supply chain problems and heavy debt load, as per reports. Notably, on Friday, Revlon's shares crashed 53% to close at $2.05, its biggest one-day drop on record. As of March-end, Revlon had long-term debt of $3.31 billion.

99.title: Canada to suspend random COVID testing at airports to reduce wait times
99.article_body: The Canadian government said that it's suspending random COVID-19 testing at all its airports from June 11 to June 30 to ease the long wait times that travellers have encountered in recent weeks. The random testing will resume "off-site" on July 1. We'll continue to "implement solutions to reduce delays as we approach the summer peak season", the government added.

100.title: Pune Police arrests Haryana-based techie for committing thefts
100.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a thief, who holds a BTech degree, for allegedly committing thefts. The accused, identified as Twinkle Arjun Arora (30), is a resident of Haryana's Ballabhgarh and had come to Pune to participate in a cricket tournament last month. Notably, Arora is suspected to have taken up criminal acts after losing money in IPL betting.

101.title: Custodial deaths show police are becoming mad: Madras High Court
101.article_body: Custodial deaths show that the police are becoming mad, Madras High Court on Friday said. "They organise gangs in the name of police. They involve in land grabbing, rape, custodial deaths...all such acts should be checked for good governance," it added. The Police Complaints Authority must be headed by a retired judge of the High Court, Madras HC further said.

102.title: 35-yr-old man held for molesting woman at railway station in Mumbai
102.article_body: A 35-year-old man from Madhya Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly touching a woman inappropriately and trying to kiss her forcibly at Khar railway station in Mumbai. The incident took place on Thursday when the woman was waiting for a train, an official said. Notably, this is the second incident wherein a woman was molested on the Western Railway network.

103.title: BJP wins 3 seats in Maha Rajya Sabha elections; Shiv Sena, Cong, NCP 1 each
103.article_body: BJP has won three out of the six seats in Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections, while Shiv Sena, Congress and NCP have won one seat each. All three BJP candidates, Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde and Dhananjay Mahadik won. From the Maha Vikas Aghadi coalition, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut, Congress' Imran Pratapgarhi and NCP's Praful Patel won the remaining three seats.

104.title: Nadal's tennis much more entertaining than Federer: Ex-world no. 1 Mats
104.article_body: Ex-world number one Mats Wilander said Rafael Nadal's tennis is "much more" entertaining than Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic's gameplay. "With Federer, everything seems easy. It's simple and aesthetic. Nadal is different: his true personality arises when the racquet hits the ball," added Mats. "Previously, there was a repetitive aspect to Nadal's game...Now he creates uncertainty," stated Mats.

105.title: Minor girl sexually assaulted by neighbour in Hyd, accused arrested
105.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a man for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl, repeatedly for the last three days. According to police, the accused lives near the victim's house and had called her on the pretext of fetching him cigarettes from a nearby shop. He then took the victim inside his house and sexually assaulted her, police added.

106.title: Bolivian court finds ex-Prez Anez guilty of coup, jailed for 10 yrs
106.article_body: A Bolivian court has found ex-President Jeanine Anez guilty of orchestrating a coup that brought her to power in 2019. She has been sentenced to 10 years in prison. She'd come to power in 2019 after ex-President Evo Morales resigned following mass protests over a disputed election in which he claimed to win a controversial fourth consecutive term in office.

107.title: Karnataka makes face masks mandatory in public places amid rising COVID-19 cases
107.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the Karnataka government on Friday issued fresh COVID-19 guidelines. It has now made the wearing of face masks mandatory in malls, closed-door events, hotels, pubs, restaurants, educational institutions, cafeterias, factories, offices, hostels and public transport. Karnataka on Friday reported 525 new COVID-19 cases with 494 cases in Bengaluru alone.

108.title: Meta probing Sheryl for using company resources to plan wedding, write her book: Report
108.article_body: Meta is investigating outgoing COO Sheryl Sandberg's use of company resources over several years, as per a report. Sheryl reportedly had her subordinates help write her book and promote her foundation on company time. She is also being probed for using company resources for her upcoming wedding, however, the report said it was a small part of the investigation.

109.title: Bengaluru police remove political banner on road sign, share pics
109.article_body: Following a complaint by a Twitter user over a political banner being put up on a road sign, Bengaluru's Malleshwaram traffic police on Friday tweeted that it has removed the banner. The traffic police also shared pictures of the same. "Flex banners have mushroomed across the city, with political functionaries using them for their 'Advertisement'," the Twitter user had said.

110.title: Britney Spears shares pics from her wedding with Sam Asghari, says 'I had a panic attack'
110.article_body: Singer Britney Spears shared video and pictures from her wedding with Sam Asghari. "It was the most spectacular day! I was so nervous all morning but then at 2:00 pm it really hit me...We're getting married! I had a panic attack and then got it together," she wrote on Instagram. She added, "So many incredible people came...I'm still in shock."

111.title: What is Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, rare condition that paralysed half of Justin Bieber's face?
111.article_body: Justin Bieber revealed he has been diagnosed with Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, which has paralysed half of his face. The syndrome is a neurological condition caused by varicella zoster virus. It occurs when a shingles outbreak affects facial nerve near one ear. Its symptoms include, severe pain in ear, painful rash on eardrum and weakness on one side of the face.

112.title: PMC identifies 16 illegally run schools, warns against admission
112.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) Education Department has identified 16 schools which have been running illegally in the civic body's jurisdiction. "It's a serious issue and our appeal to all the parents would be not to take admission in these schools," the district's deputy director of education said. This is in addition to 27 other illegal schools identified earlier in Pune.

113.title: Justin Bieber reveals he has facial paralysis due to Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, shares video
113.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber took to Instagram to reveal he's suffering from facial paralysis due to Ramsay Hunt Syndrome. "As you can see this eye is not blinking...I can't smile on this side of my face...So there's full paralysis on [right] side of my face," he said in a video. Bieber said he doesn't know how long it'll take to recover.

114.title: Who is Choe Son-hui, North Korea's 1st female Foreign Minister?
114.article_body: North Korea's first female Foreign Minister Choe Son-hui is a veteran diplomat who formerly served as Vice Foreign Minister. Choe served as a close aide to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during nuclear talks with US and accompanied him to summits with then US President Donald Trump. Choe was tapped to lead the ministry at a meeting overseen by Kim.

115.title: Pakistan to ban govt officials from buying new cars to secure IMF bailout
115.article_body: In a bid to secure IMF bailout money amid its financial crisis, Pakistan will raise taxes on the rich and will impose a ban on government officials from buying new cars. Pakistan will now impose a 2% additional tax on individuals with an annual income of PKR 30 million. The nation will also privatise government assets amid the ongoing crisis.

116.title: Will request Haryana for more water on humanitarian grounds: Delhi CM
116.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that he would request Haryana to release more water on humanitarian grounds. Delhi's water production has fallen by around 100 million gallons per day, Delhi Jal Board (DJB) vice-chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj said. The level of water at Wazirabad pond has dropped from the normal of 674.5 feet to 667.7 feet, Bharadwaj added.

117.title: 120 kg of poppy seized from a truck in J&K's Udhampur
117.article_body: Police seized 120 kg of poppy from a truck on Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in Udhampur district, officials said. During a routine check, a police team intercepted a truck in which a special cabin was detected in a toolbox, inside which five bags of poppy were found, the officials added. The truck driver escaped from the spot, police said.

118.title: 90-year-old unvaccinated woman dies of COVID-19 in MP's Indore
118.article_body: A 90-year-old woman, who had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, died of the infection in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, a health official said. The woman was suffering from high blood pressure and other ailments for a long time. She was admitted to a hospital, where she tested positive for COVID-19 and died on Thursday, the Chief Medical and Health Officer said.

119.title: Sadhguru has shown power of Indian soil to the world: MP CM
119.article_body: Addressing the 'Mitti Bachao Jan-Jagran' programme, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said Isha Foundation founder Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev has shown the power of Indian soil to the world. He added that Madhya Pradesh will work step-by-step in his 'Save Soil' campaign. "Our goal is to strengthen the ecosystem by maintaining the natural balance," Chouhan said.

120.title: 4 men rob Punjab businessman of ₹1 crore cash at gunpoint
120.article_body: Four men entered an office in Punjab's Dera Bassi on the pretext of meeting a property dealer, threatened him at gunpoint and escaped with a bag containing ₹1 crore in cash. Police said the businessman, Harjit Nagpal, sold his ancestral property and had the cash with him. While escaping, the accused shot a food vendor who tried to catch them.

121.title: 22-year-old man arrested for rape & murder of minor in Kota
121.article_body: Police said that a 22-year-old man was arrested for murdering a minor, whose mutilated body was found two days after she went missing from Rajasthan's Kota. The 17-year-old victim had befriended the accused on social media, Kota SP Kesar Singh said. The accused raped the victim and murdered her after she decided to end the relationship with him, Singh added.

122.title: PM Modi meets his 88-year-old former teacher in Gujarat, pic goes viral
122.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday met with his former teacher Jagdish Nayak during his one-day visit to Gujarat. A picture of the PM with 88-year-old Nayak went viral online. "Though it was a short meeting, I do not have words to describe how I felt," said Nayak. "His (PM's) respect and feelings for me have not changed," he added.

123.title: It's wrong to say 4th COVID-19 wave is coming: ICMR official amid case surge
123.article_body: It's not right to say that the fourth wave of COVID-19 is coming in India, ADG of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said on Friday, amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. "We need to examine district-level data. A high number of cases in a few districts can't be considered a uniform increase," said Dr Samiran Panda.

124.title: ED issues fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi for appearance on June 23
124.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23 in an alleged money laundering case related to newspaper National Herald, officials said. Earlier this week, Sonia had sought more time from the agency to appear before it as she was still recovering from COVID-19.

125.title: SRK teared up, told NCB 'We've been painted as monsters' after Aryan's arrest: Report
125.article_body: Speaking to India Today, Sanjay Singh, NCB's DDG (operations), revealed Shah Rukh Khan met him and raised concerns about Aryan Khan when he was in custody. "Almost in tears, Shah Rukh...told Sanjay, 'We've been painted as...big criminals or monsters who are out to destroy society'," said India Today. "We find going to work tough every day," he reportedly said.

126.title: Ukraine calls for more weapons from the West to fight Russian forces
126.article_body: Ukraine on Friday sought more help from the West, including quicker deliveries of weapons, to fight the advancing Russian forces. "Everything now depends on what (the West) gives us. Ukraine has one artillery piece to 10 to 15 Russian artillery pieces," a Ukrainian official said. Recently, Russia had warned the West against supplying weapons to Ukraine.

127.title: No, not T20 as yet: Shastri on picking Umran for T20 World Cup
127.article_body: Asked if pacer Umran Malik should be picked in India's squad for T20 World Cup, Ravi Shastri said, "No, not T20 as yet. Groom him. Take him with your team." He added, "If anything, let him start playing white-ball cricket, that's 50-over cricket, maybe even red-ball cricket." Umran wasn't included in India's playing XI for first T20I against South Africa.

128.title: Kerala Cong protests, seeks CM's resignation over gold smuggling
128.article_body: Kerala Congress leaders protested in the state against CM Pinarayi Vijayan and demanded his resignation over the gold smuggling case. "They are trying to threaten the persons who are ready to give evidence against the CM," Kerala Opposition leader VD Satheesan said.  This comes after the prime accused claimed CM, his wife and daughter were involved in the scam.

129.title: BJP office set on fire in WB's Howrah amid protests, internet suspended in district
129.article_body: BJP office in West Bengal's Howrah was set on fire by those protesting against remarks made by two former BJP leaders on Prophet Muhammad. BJP leader Anirban Ganguly shared a video of the vandalised office and sought action against the rioters. Following the incident, internet services were suspended till 6 am on June 13 (Monday).

130.title: 8 men risk having their fingers cut off after being convicted of theft in Iran
130.article_body: Eight Iranian men convicted of theft are in risk of having their fingers on one hand cut off, an NGO warned, decrying the punishment as "inhuman". Authorities have reportedly informed the men that they will be transferred to a prison with a guillotine machine in the coming days. "We call on the international community to urgently intervene," said Amnesty International.

131.title: India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage crosses 194 cr
131.article_body: The Union Health Ministry said that the cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 194.90 crore on Friday. More than 13 lakh coronavirus vaccine doses have been administered till 7 pm today, it added. Notably, over 3.50 crore children in the age group of 12-14 years have been administered the first dose so far.

132.title: No idea: Raducanu on playing Wimbledon after being injured in Nottingham
132.article_body: US Open champion Emma Raducanu said she has "no idea" whether she'll be fit enough to compete at this year's Wimbledon after suffering a "freak" injury in first round at Nottingham Open on Tuesday. The 19-year-old was trailing 4-3 in first set against Switzerland's Viktorija Golubic when she retired with what appeared to be a side strain or rib injury.

133.title: Govt issues new guidelines to curb misleading ads, violators to face ₹10 lakh fine
133.article_body: The government has released new guidelines to prevent false and misleading ads. The new guidelines define 'bait advertisement', 'surrogate advertisement' and 'free claims advertisement'. It lays down provisions regarding ads targeting children and bars Indian and foreigner professionals from endorsing brands. Violation of these guidelines may lead to up to ₹10 lakh penalty for first offence.

134.title: When US sneezes, world catches a cold: Kotak as US inflation hits 40-yr-high
134.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak tweeted, "Let's remember that when US sneezes, the world catches a cold," after US inflation reached 8.6% in May. It's the highest level of inflation recorded in US in over 4 decades as gas, food, and shelter prices continue to surge. "Cannot believe average Fed funds rate still below 1% pa," Kotak further said.

135.title: Quad important for free and open Indo-Pacific: Japanese PM
135.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday said that the four-nation Quad grouping of the US, India, Japan and Australia is playing an important role in promoting a free and open Indo-Pacific. Kishida made the comment at a defence conclave in Singapore. Notably, leaders of Quad countries had met for a summit last month in Japan.

136.title: 109 arrested in UP after violent protests over remarks on Prophet
136.article_body: A total of 109 people were arrested on Friday after protests erupted in parts of Uttar Pradesh over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. CM Yogi Adityanath has instructed officials to take "stringent action against anti-social elements". Incidents of stone-pelting and sloganeering were reported, following which police used tear gas and resorted to lathicharge to disperse mobs.

137.title: Concerned about temporary blip in LIC share price: Govt as stock hits record low
137.article_body: The government is "very concerned about the temporary blip in LIC share price", DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said as the state-run insurer's shares hit record low on Friday. Shares of LIC touched all-time low of ₹708.05, wiping out over ₹1.51 lakh crore in investors' wealth since listing. Pandey said that the LIC management will raise the shareholders' value.

138.title: 2 tigers die in a single day in MP's Panna Tiger Reserve
138.article_body: Two tigers died in Madhya Pradesh's Panna Tiger Reserve (PTR) in a single day on Thursday, officials said. "The tiger P-111 was over 13 years old and was suffering from kidney disease...The 10-month-old cub P-234 died in a territorial fight," PTR Field Director Uttam Kumar Sharma said. The body of the cub had scratch marks, officials added.

139.title: Maintain peace: Maha minister amid protest over Prophet remarks
139.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil urged people to maintain peace and cooperate with the police in maintaining law and order. His appeal came after protests erupted in parts of Maharashtra against controversial remarks by a former BJP leader on Prophet Muhammad. Patil said the state government and the Home Department have taken a serious note of Nupur Sharma's remarks.

140.title: S African Prez urges probe into money laundering claims against him
140.article_body: After being accused of money laundering by a former intelligence official, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that the police should be allowed to investigate him. The ex-official claimed that money laundering by Ramaphosa had come to light after robbers stole "millions" from the President's game farm in 2020. Notably, Ramaphosa claimed the money had come from a legitimate source.

141.title: Russia & China open first cross-border road bridge as ties deepen
141.article_body: Russia and China on Friday unveiled the first road bridge between the two countries, according to state media. Notably, this comes amid deepening ties between the two countries in response to tensions with the West over several issues. The bridge links the Russian city of Blagoveshchensk to the Chinese city of Heihe across the Amur river.

142.title: Never imagined my nephew Nadal would win everything he has won: Toni
142.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he never imagined that his nephew would win everything he has won. "I'm surprised by what Rafa does, that with the pain he has, he's able to think about the ball and not about his foot," he added. Nadal has been dealing with a chronic foot problem.

143.title: LIC stock hits all-time low, wipes off ₹1.5 lakh cr investor wealth since listing
143.article_body: LIC stock hit record lows of ₹708.05 on NSE and ₹708.80 on BSE on Friday, down over 25% from its issue price of ₹949. LIC's market capitalisation fell to ₹4.49 lakh crore at the end of trade on Friday from ₹6 lakh crore, BSE data showed. LIC shareholders lost ₹1.51 lakh crore in less than a month of its listing.

144.title: Mumbai logs 1,956 new COVID-19 cases, highest since Jan; positivity rate at 12.7%
144.article_body: Mumbai on Friday reported 1,956 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily rise in infections since January 23. The daily rise in cases is also nearly 15% higher than the number of cases reported on Thursday. The city reported a positivity rate of 12.7%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 9,191.

145.title: 'My reputation is ruined, did I really deserve it?' Aryan Khan told NCB
145.article_body: Speaking to India Today, Sanjay Singh, NCB's DDG (operations), revealed his conversation with Aryan Khan. As per Sanjay, Aryan told him, "They didn't find any drugs on my person...yet they arrested me. Sir, you've done me great wrong and ruined my reputation." "Why did I have to spend so many weeks in jail- did I really deserve it?" he said.

146.title: Sitharaman & 2 other BJP leaders win in K'taka Rajya Sabha polls, Cong wins 1 seat
146.article_body: Three BJP candidates bagged Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka in polls for the Upper House held on Friday, while the remaining one seat went to a Congress candidate. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Kannada comedian Jaggesh and Karnataka Legislative Council member Lehar Siroya were BJP's winning candidates. Congress' Jairam Ramesh won the remaining seat that went to the polls on Friday.

147.title: 6-time world champion Mary Kom ruled out of Commonwealth Games 2022
147.article_body: India's six-time world champion boxer Mary Kom has been ruled out of Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, the Boxing Federation of India announced. The 39-year-old boxer suffered an injury on the second day of the ongoing CWG trials in Delhi. She twisted her left knee during the Round 1 of her bout against Nitu. Nitu was declared winner of the bout.

148.title: Malaysia to abolish mandatory death penalty: Law Minister
148.article_body: Malaysia's Law Minister has said that the country will abolish the mandatory death penalty and allow judges to set alternative punishments for a range of offences. The Cabinet also agreed to study substitute sentences for all offences carrying the death penalty, the minister added. Notably, over 1,300 people are on death row in Malaysia, with most cases involving drug trafficking.

149.title: Congress wins 3 seats, BJP 1 in Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections
149.article_body: The Congress has won three out of four seats, while BJP has won the remaining one in the Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections. Zee TV Founder and independent candidate Subhash Chandra, who was backed by the BJP, has lost the elections. "Congress' victory in three Rajya Sabha seats in Rajasthan is a victory for democracy," Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot tweeted.

150.title: India's campaign ends after Sindhu crashes out of Indonesia Masters 2022
150.article_body: PV Sindhu has crashed out of 2022 Indonesia Masters Super 500 tournament, ending India's campaign on Friday. Fourth-seeded Sindhu lost to fifth-seeded Ratchanok Intanon 12-21, 10-21 in the women's singles quarter-final. The match lasted 33 minutes. This was Sindhu's fifth straight loss against Intanon. The Indian shuttler is now 4-9 in head-to-head against her Thai opponent.

151.title: Show cause notices to 102 Assam schools over poor Class 10 results
151.article_body: The Assam Secondary Education Department has served show cause notices to 102 schools run by the state government for poor results of their students in the Class 10 examinations. Secondary Education Director Mamata Hojai said the schools' pass percentage was 10% and below. "Out of 102 schools, 25 schools have shown 0% results," Hojai added.

152.title: Sri Lanka could face full-blown humanitarian emergency, says UN
152.article_body: Speaking about the severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the UN on Friday said, "We're concerned that this could develop into a full-blown humanitarian emergency." "The Sri Lankan economy is on the brink of collapse," it added. Sri Lankans have been facing daily blackouts, long queues for petrol and record inflation for the past few months due to the crisis.

153.title: He tried to stay ahead of the game: Smith on Pant's T20I captaincy debut
153.article_body: Praising Rishabh Pant following his captaincy debut for India against South Africa in first T20I, ex-South Africa skipper Graeme Smith said it was a "good night in terms of decision-making" and he'll gain "quite a bit of confidence" from it. "He tried to stay ahead of the game," Smith added. South Africa beat India by seven wickets on Thursday.

154.title: Pictures from Britney Spears' wedding with Sam Asghari surface online
154.article_body: Britney Spears and Sam Asghari tied the knot on Thursday at their Thousand Oaks home in Los Angeles. Photos from their wedding ceremony, which have surfaced online, show her wearing a long white Versace gown. Guests at the wedding included Selena Gomez, Madonna, Drew Barrymore, Paris Hilton, Donatella Versace and Will.i.am.

155.title: We'll strictly blacklist those leaving us for money: Allen Co-founder to educators
155.article_body: Allen Career Institute's Co-founder Brajesh Maheshwari, in a video shared with employees, said the institute will "strictly blacklist" educators who are leaving Allen because of "greed for money". He added, "They should better understand that they will never be allowed to come back to Allen ever." Maheshwari's remarks come after edtech unicorn Unacademy opens its offline centre in Kota.

156.title: I'd have Karthik in at that 5 or 6 slot in India's T20 WC squad: Ponting
156.article_body: Ricky Ponting said he would pick wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "I'd have him in at that five or six roles. The way...he finished games for RCB this year, he took his game to another level," he added. Karthik scored 330 runs in 16 matches at a strike rate of 183.33 in IPL 2022.

157.title: Jama Masjid protest held without permit, will take legal action: Delhi Police
157.article_body: After a protest erupted at Delhi's Jama Masjid on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad, police said they have identified some "miscreants" behind the agitation. "Protests were done on the street without any permission, so legal action will be taken," DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. Chauhan added that police brought the situation under control within 10-15 minutes.

158.title: What is Amyloidosis, the condition that Pak's ex-Prez Pervez Musharraf is suffering from?
158.article_body: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf is suffering from Amyloidosis, his family said. It's a rare disease that occurs when amyloid proteins are deposited in tissues and organs. Amyloid proteins are abnormal proteins the body cannot break down and recycle. Buildup of amyloid deposits damages organs and tissues and it most frequently affects kidneys, heart, nervous system and liver.

159.title: Will not hesitate to start war over Taiwan, China tells US
159.article_body: Beijing will "not hesitate to start a war" if Taiwan declares independence, China's Defence Minister warned his US counterpart Lloyd Austin. This came as Wei Fenghe held his first face-to-face meeting with Austin on sidelines of Shangri-La Dialogue security summit in Singapore. Fenghe vowed Beijing would "smash to smithereens any 'Taiwan independence' plot", said Chinese Defence Ministry.

160.title: MP man carries 4-yr-old daughter's body after being denied hearse
160.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Chhattarpur district was purportedly seen carrying the body of his four-year-old daughter, as he was unable to find an ambulance. The girl's grandfather claimed that the family had also asked for a hearse at the Damoh district hospital, but was not provided one by authorities. A civil surgeon at the hospital has denied the claim.

161.title: Tourist causes ₹20 lakh in damage to Roman heritage site by throwing e-scooter
161.article_body: An American tourist caused damages worth £21,000 (around ₹20 lakh) after she deliberately threw an e-scooter down the famous 18th-century Spanish steps in Rome. The 28-year-old and her 29-year-old male companion were fined £343 (around ₹33,000) each over the incident. The 16th and 29th steps of the UNESCO World Heritage site were damaged and other sections were also chipped.

162.title: Body of man who fell from Sikkim bridge while clicking pics found
162.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) has recovered the body of a local driver, who fell into the riverbed from Sikkim's Rit Chu Bridge while clicking pictures. The driver, along with a tourist, was clicking pictures while standing at the edge of the bridge when they both lost balance and fell. Search for the missing tourist from Bihar is underway.

163.title: PM Modi unveils development projects worth ₹3,050 crore in Gujarat
163.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of multiple development projects worth ₹3,050 crore during 'Gujarat Gaurav Abhiyan' programme in Gujarat's Navsari. These projects are aimed at improving the water supply in the region, along with boosting connectivity and enhancing the ease of living. "We treat being in government as an opportunity to serve," he said.

164.title: I was told to get breast implants, botox; it made me angrier: Radhika Apte
164.article_body: Radhika Apte revealed that when she was new in the film industry, she was told "to do lots of jobs" on her body and face. "First meeting I had, I was told to change my nose. Second meeting...I was told to get a boob job...Then I was told to do...botox," she stated. "I never felt pressurised...I felt angrier," said Radhika.

165.title: 4 persons arrested for beating suspected thief to death in Mumbai
165.article_body: Police said that four persons have been arrested for allegedly beating a suspected thief to death in Mumbai's Mulund area. The 28-year-old deceased had entered a house intending to steal valuables, police said. One of the four occupants of the house noticed and caught him, after which all four of them assaulted the victim with wooden sticks, police added.

166.title: India to provide 5,000 tonnes of rice in aid to Madagascar
166.article_body: India has announced that it will provide 5,000 tonnes of rice in aid to Madagascar amid a humanitarian crisis in the country. The announcement comes after a meeting between the Ambassador of India to Madagascar and Comoros, Abhay Kumar, and Madagascar's PM Christian Ntsay. The shipment of rice from India to the island nation is likely to reach in July.

167.title: 30-yr-old Navi Mumbai man arrested, drugs worth ₹60,000 seized
167.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested by the Anti-Narcotics Cell of the Crime Branch in Navi Mumbai's Taloja for selling charas behind a school. Police said they seized 75 grams of charas worth ₹60,000 from the accused. The accused Jai Santosh Gufta was selling drugs to the youth and where he got the drugs from is being investigated, the police added.

168.title: 4 persons arrested for auto driver's murder in Hyderabad
168.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four persons involved in the murder of an auto driver, who had stopped them from extorting money from a transgender. Charminar ACP G Bhiksham Reddy said the accused attacked the auto driver and his friend on June 5 with knives and liquor bottles. The auto driver succumbed to injuries on the way to the hospital.

169.title: Policeman opens fire in Kolkata, shoots woman before killing self
169.article_body: A policeman allegedly fired several shots using his service rifle outside the Bangladesh Deputy High Commission in Kolkata's Park Circus area on Friday. A woman, who was riding pillion on a two-wheeler, fell down after being hit by a bullet, and died on the spot, police said. The accused policeman later shot himself dead. Preliminary investigations are underway, police added.

170.title: Woman dies on wedding anniversary as bus hits motorbike in Hyd
170.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was killed while her husband escaped with injuries on their wedding anniversary after a bus rammed into their motorbike in Hyderabad on Thursday. "The couple along with their son Bunny went to a temple near Chandanagar and the accident occurred...while they were returning home," police said. The woman's husband and their son were rushed to a hospital.

171.title: Mob in J&K's Bhaderwah defies curfew, pelts stones; CRPF trooper hurt
171.article_body: A mob of around 150 people on Friday morning came out on the streets and pelted stones at security personnel in Bhaderwah town of Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district. A Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel has sustained injuries in the incident. According to a police officer, security forces had to fire tear gas shells to disperse the mob.

172.title: India's Lakshya Sen loses in quarters at Indonesia Masters 2022
172.article_body: India's Lakshya Sen lost to Chou Tien Chen in the quarter-finals of Indonesia Masters Super 500 tournament on Friday. Third-seeded Tien Chen beat the World Championships bronze medallist 21-16, 12-21, 21-14 in one hour two minutes. This was Lakshya's second straight defeat against Tien Chen in less than a month, having lost during the group stage of the Thomas Cup.

173.title: He takes his job seriously: Paytm CEO on 'number of days' timer in MoS IT's office
173.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to share a picture with Minister of State for Electronics & Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar after meeting with him on Friday. "Rarely you will meet someone who takes his job so seriously, and puts a number of days timer," Sharma said, referring to a clock in Chandrasekhar's office.
