348.article_body: South Africa chased down a target of 212 in the first T20I against India to register their highest successful chase in T20I history. South Africa's previous highest successful T20I run chase had come on September 11, 2007, when they chased down a 206-run target against West Indies. With the win, South Africa ended India's record-equalling 12-match winning streak in T20Is.

349.title: BJP MLA's daughter in BMW stopped over rash driving in B'luru; seen yelling at police
349.article_body: A video shows BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali's daughter misbehaving with Bengaluru traffic policemen after they stopped her over traffic violation and reportedly fined her for rash driving. The MLA's daughter, who was driving a BMW car, could be seen yelling at the policemen. She also tried to slap away a journalist's camera and said, "Shut the camera off."

350.title: Punjab rolls out new excise policy, liquor prices to drop by 35-60%
350.article_body: Punjab Cabinet on Wednesday approved the state's new excise policy, allowing the sale of an unlimited quota of beer and Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL). The move is expected to bring down liquor prices by 35-60% from July 1 onwards and curb smuggling of illegal liquor. Excise duty on IMFL, beer and imported foreign liquor has been kept at 1%.

351.title: Finland to build barriers on its border with Russia amid NATO bid
351.article_body: Finland plans to amend its border legislation to allow building of barriers along the country's border with Russia, the Finnish government said on Thursday. This comes amid Finland's recent bid to join NATO following Russia's military offensive against Ukraine. Finland shares a 1,300-km long border with Russia, which is marked with signs and plastic lines for most of the stretch.

352.title: Those with monkeypox symptoms should get tested: UP CM Adityanath
352.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has asked the health department to remain on alert in the wake of the rise in monkeypox cases across the globe and asked those with symptoms to get tested. The state hasn't reported a single case of the infection, however, the UP government has asked the departments to monitor people who are returning from abroad.

353.title: Sri Lanka seeks India, China & Middle East's help amid forex crisis
353.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa held a meeting with senior diplomats from India, China and the Middle East on Thursday and sought assistance amid the country's ongoing forex crisis. India has provided support worth over $3.5 billion while extending an additional $500 million credit line to the cash-strapped country. China has pledged aid worth approximately $74 million to Sri Lanka.

354.title: Which are the top 10 economies for FDIs as per UN?
354.article_body: India is among the top 10 economies for FDI inflows in 2021, ranking 7th after the US, China, Hong Kong, Singapore, Canada and Brazil, according to United Nations Conference on Trade and Development's latest World Investment Report. South Africa, Russia and Mexico rounded up the top 10 economies for FDI inflows in 2021.

355.title: SEBI lets off Tata Motors for concealing facts in 18-year-old case
355.article_body: SEBI has let off Tata Motors Limited (TML) with a warning to be "more careful" in its future dealings in the securities market. SEBI said adverse orders passed now may not practically serve any purpose for events accrued over 18 years ago. It was alleged that Tata Finance, which was merged with TML, concealed true and correct facts from investors.

356.title: BJP corporator, leader attacked with sticks, shot at in UP
356.article_body: A BJP corporator and her husband, who is a BJP leader, were allegedly assaulted by some miscreants with sticks, while they were returning home in UP's Prayagraj, police said on Thursday. The couple alleged the accused opened fire and snatched Ramkumar Yadav's chain while escaping. Rinki Yadav was assaulted when she tried to save her husband, the complainant said.

357.title: Vishal Bhardwaj's film 'Khufiya' is not a regular spy thriller: Tabu
357.article_body: Speaking about working with filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj in 'Khufiya', actress Tabu said the film is Vishal's dear project, which was conceptualised long back but couldn't happen. "Then...pandemic happened, which is when it picked up again. We were casting for it during COVID-19. It's the world of intelligence [and] agents...but not like...regular spy thriller that [people have seen]," she added.

358.title: Kerala CM must reveal his income sources: BJP leader amid gold scam
358.article_body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan said CM Pinarayi Vijayan must reveal the sources of wealth accumulated by himself and his family members. His comment comes after the main accused in Kerala gold smuggling case alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife and daughter's involvement in the case. "The CM has to explain each detail of the allegations...against him," Radhakrishnan added.

359.title: PM Modi has brought a new culture to political working: Nadda in WB
359.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, who is on a two-day visit to West Bengal, said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has brought a new culture to political working in the country. Criticising the ruling party TMC, Nadda said, "Condition of West Bengal right now is similar to what India was famous for several years ago, scams and corruption."

360.title: 3 arrested for murder of elderly couple in Kolkata
360.article_body: The Kolkata Police have arrested three persons in connection with the murder of an elderly couple, whose bodies were found on Monday in their house in Kolkata's Bhowanipore area, police said. "It was a pre-planned murder," Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Kumar Goyal said. "The mastermind, who is a distant relative of the couple, is still absconding," Goyal added.

361.title: Don't arm demilitarised islands: Turkish Prez Erdoğan tells Greece
361.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has told Greece to demilitarise islands in Aegean Sea, which Turkey claims are being armed in violation of treaties that guarantee islands' unarmed status. Turkey further states that islands were ceded to Greece on the condition that they won't be militarised. Turkey recently halted bilateral talks with Greece, which began in 2021 after five-year hiatus.

362.title: Mumbai records 1,702 new COVID-19 cases; positivity rate at 9.64%
362.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,702 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, 63 less than the 1,765 new infections reported on Wednesday. With 7,998 active cases, the city's positivity rate stands at 9.64% while its recovery rate has dipped to 97%. Mumbai's total caseload rose to 10,75,243 while its death toll rose to 19,570 as one patient succumbed to the virus on Thursday.

363.title: 5 killed, 3 injured as vehicle falls into gorge in U'khand
363.article_body: Five people were killed and three injured after their vehicle fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Tehri district on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred around 2:45 pm when the vehicle was on its way to Saud village, Ghansali Police Station in-charge Sukhpal Singh Mann said. Police, SDRF personnel retrieved the bodies with the help of locals, the SHO said.

364.title: Congress leader confuses Goddess Sita with Draupadi, says 'cheerharan of Sita Maiya'
364.article_body: During a press conference, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala confused Goddess Sita with Draupadi and said, "BJP wants to do cheerharan of democracy, just like cheerharan of Sita Maiya. But they'll lose [in Rajya Sabha polls]." Criticising Surjewala for the error, BJP's Shehzad Poonawala said, "You can wear Janeu on the coat but what's inside you will always come out!"

365.title: Rahul Gandhi to appear before ED on June 13, Cong plans protest
365.article_body: Congress will hold protests on June 13 when party leader Rahul Gandhi will appear before the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. Congress called the case a "political vendetta", adding that the case has no grounds for investigation. ED questioned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge and Congress Treasurer Pawan Bansal in April this year in New Delhi.

366.title: CRED raises $80 mn in Series F funding at $6.5 bn valuation: Report
366.article_body: Fintech unicorn CRED has raised $80 million (₹617 crore) of fresh capital in its Series F funding round at a valuation of $6.5 billion, Entrackr reported. According to a regulatory filing with the Registrar of Companies, CRED approved issuance of 42,308 Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares at a price of ₹1,45,846.98. CRED's current valuation has risen 60% from $4.01 billion.

367.title: NASA to launch study into unexplained aerial phenomena
367.article_body: NASA will host a media teleconference at 1 pm EDT (10:30 pm IST) on Thursday to discuss a new team it is commissioning to examine unidentified aerial phenomena (UAPs). This comes after years of speculation about events in the sky that cannot be identified as aircraft or known natural phenomena. "There's no evidence UAPs are extra-terrestrial in origin," NASA stated.

368.title: India record their highest T20I total against South Africa
368.article_body: India on Thursday recorded their highest T20I total against South Africa after registering 211/4 in their 20 overs in the first T20I in Delhi. Ishan Kishan top-scored for India with 76 runs off 48 deliveries. India's previous highest T20I total against South Africa had come on February 18, 2018, when they recorded 203/5 in Johannesburg.

369.title: You're such an inspiration: Soni on Mahima Chaudhry's battle with cancer
369.article_body: After actor Anupam Kher shared actress Mahima Chaudhry's video where she revealed that she battled cancer, actress Soni Razdan reacted to the same. Taking to Instagram, Soni wrote, "Wow what an empowering story and thank you Anupam and Mahima for letting us hear this. Lots of love and good health to you. You're such an inspiration @mahimachaudhry1."

370.title: Let this love also be seen off-camera: Govinda on Krushna breaking down while apologising
370.article_body: Govinda, in an appearance on Maniesh Paul's podcast, responded to his estranged nephew Krushna's apology.  When Maniesh told him that Krushna was apologetic on the show and that he loves him, Govinda replied, "Then let the love be seen off-camera too." Krushna broke down on the show and said he misses his uncle "a lot".

371.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature on Thursday released
371.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that reported maximum temperature of 45°C or more on Thursday. Haryana's Faridabad reported the highest maximum temperature of 47.1°C, followed by 47°C in Rajasthan's Ganganagar. Delhi's Mungeshpur and Punjab's Bathinda recorded maximum temperature of 46.8°C. Baloda Bazaar recorded 46.4°C as maximum temperature while Mewat recorded 46.3°C.

372.title: Mira Rajput supports Vidya Balan & Shefali Shah for calling out sexism at home
372.article_body: In an interview, actresses Vidya Balan and Shefali Shah spoke about the double standards toward men and women that are practised in every home. Actor Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput supported Vidya and Shefali's remarks and said a woman's work deserves respect. Vidya had said in the interview, "Domestic workers don't mind interrupting me but they mind interrupting Siddharth (husband)."

373.title: Satyendar Jain is suffering from post-COVID sleep apnea: Lawyer
373.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain, who is in Enforcement Directorate's (ED) custody for alleged money laundering, is suffering from post-COVID sleep apnea, his lawyer said. "When [Jain] came out of...court, he wasn't feeling well and was later sent to...hospital," advocate Rishikesh Kumar said. Jain will be under ED's custody till June 13, a Delhi court ruled earlier today.

374.title: Iran deletes its statement on discussing Prophet remark with NSA Ajit Doval
374.article_body: Iran has pulled down its readout, wherein it stated that Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian raised concerns about remarks against Prophet Muhammad in his meeting with NSA Ajit Doval. The readout had stated that Doval had assured action. However, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson refused to comment on their meeting and pointed out that Iran's statement has been deleted.

375.title: Go protest in Delhi: Mamata to Nupur Sharma hate speech protesters
375.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday asked protesters protesting against the remarks of BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal to take their demonstrations to New Delhi. The speech of the BJP leaders has damaged the image of India across the world and they should be arrested, Banerjee told reporters.

376.title: 6-yr-old girl killed in a leopard attack in MP's Mhow
376.article_body: A six-year-old girl was killed in a leopard attack at a village in Madhya Pradesh's Mhow in the early hours of Thursday, an official said. The incident took place when the girl, Ravina Wasnik, was sleeping with her parents outside their house, Choral forest range officer Rahul Jain said. The leopard escaped when the parents raised an alarm, he added.

377.title: Which players have captained India in T20I cricket?
377.article_body: Rishabh Pant today became the eighth player to lead India in T20Is. Virender Sehwag had captained India in their first-ever T20I match in 2006. MS Dhoni captained India in most T20Is (72), while Virat Kohli captained in 50 T20Is. Rohit Sharma has led India in 28 T20Is so far. Suresh Raina, Ajinkya Rahane and Shikhar Dhawan have also captained India.

378.title: Twitter agrees to share data on bots after Musk threatens to terminate $44bn deal: Report
378.article_body: Twitter will yield to Elon Musk's demand for internal data, the Washington Post reported. This comes days after Musk threatened to terminate his $44 billion deal to purchase Twitter, accusing it of failing to provide data on fake accounts. The report cited a source as saying that Twitter's board decided to let Musk access its full "firehose" of internal data.

379.title: Will hit the streets if textbook revisions not rolled back in K'taka: Cong
379.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that his party will take the protest to the streets if the state government does not roll back revised school textbooks. He added that this has hurt the sentiments of Kannadigas. Siddaramaiah said, "The textbook has been revised by Rohith Chakrathirtha (head of the textbook revision committee), who is an orthodox RSS man."

380.title: South Africa batter Aiden Markram tests positive for coronavirus in India
380.article_body: South Africa batter Aiden Markram, who is a part of the Proteas' squad for the five-match T20I series against India, has tested positive for coronavirus. South Africa captain Temba Bavuma revealed the development at the toss ahead of the first T20I. Markram, who was originally scheduled to play the first T20I, has been replaced by debutant Tristan Stubbs.

381.title: 5 arrested for selling land using fake papers in Bengaluru
381.article_body: Five persons were arrested for allegedly creating fake documents for a site in Bengaluru's Vidyaranyapura and selling it to third party without the owner's knowledge, police said. The site belonged to Karthik BS, who is settled in Kuwait. One of the accused noticed that a site had been lying vacant and teamed up with others to sell it, police added.

382.title: 81% COVID-19 cases reported in 4 states/UTs in the last 24 hours: Govt
382.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in India, the Centre on Thursday said that 81% cases in the last 24 hours have been reported in Maharashtra, Kerala, Delhi and Karnataka (in descending order of number of new cases reported). India reported a total of 7,240 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. The government asked the states not to lower their guard.

383.title: People want to pull you down: Govinda on film industry turning against him
383.article_body: When asked if he feels bad when the film industry accuses him of being unprofessional and tardy, actor Govinda said, "When you're successful, there are many who'll try to pull you down." "When I was at the peak for 14-15 years, when everything was going in my favour, nobody raised...issues...This is...film industry, people change with time," he added.

384.title: Delhi records 622 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, positivity rate at 3.17%
384.article_body: Delhi on Thursday reported 622 new COVID-19 cases, with its positivity rate rising to 3.17% compared with 2.84% on Wednesday. The national capital reported two deaths with 1,072 patients in home isolation. A total of 20,885 beneficiaries were vaccinated in the last 24 hours, with 2,450 beneficiaries being administered the first dose and 7,431 beneficiaries being administered the second dose.

385.title: Ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh is nothing: Father of man killed in J&K
385.article_body: The father of Rahul Bhat, a government employee who was killed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam on May 12, has said that the ex-gratia amount of ₹5 lakh received by the family is "nothing". "Don't treat us like beggars. My son was killed...on duty," Bittuji Bhat said. He further demanded that government should initiate inquiry on Rahul's murder.

386.title: UP Police takes action against over 1.29 lakh illegal loudspeakers
386.article_body: Following directions from the Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government, UP Police have taken action against over 1.29 lakh loudspeakers across the state. Over 72,500 loudspeakers have been removed from various religious places while the sound level of 56,558 loudspeakers was reduced and brought down to the level of standard parameters, according to reports.

387.title: Monitoring developments: India as US General calls Chinese activity near Ladakh 'alarming'
387.article_body: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday said, "The government carefully monitors development along our border areas including construction of infrastructure by Chinese side in Western sector." He added that it took all adequate measures to safeguard territorial integrity. This comes after a US General called the buildup of Chinese infrastructure near Ladakh "alarming".

388.title: India reacts to vandalisation of Hindu temple in Pak, says 'we've conveyed our protest'
388.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday said that it has noted the recent incident of vandalisation of a Hindu temple in Pakistan's Karachi. "We believe it's another act of systemic persecution of religious minorities. We've conveyed our protest to Pakistan government, urging them to ensure safety, security and well-being of its minority communities," it added.

389.title: Making phone calls to Putin is like talking to Hitler: Poland Prez
389.article_body: Poland's President Andrzej Duda has reportedly criticised leaders of France and Germany for their telephonic conversations with Russian President Vladimir Putin and compared it to conversing with Adolf Hitler during World War II. Duda added that there's no evidence that conversations had led to peace process amid Russia-Ukraine war. Poland has taken in over 3 million Ukrainian refugees since war.

390.title: Over 200 cases of call centres extorting money reported in Gurugram
390.article_body: Gurugram Police said it has received over 200 complaints of bogus call centres that allegedly extort money from their targets on the pretext of recovering loans since December 2021. Most victims targeted are those who took loans through Chinese applications and defaulted on payments. The call centres' employees are given 25% of the money they extort, said ACP Indiwar.

391.title: India's playing XI for 1st T20I against South Africa announced
391.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first T20I in Delhi on Thursday. India are being led by Rishabh Pant for the first time. Ishan Kishan and Ruturaj Gaikwad will open the batting for India. Meanwhile, Dinesh Karthik is playing an international match after nearly three years.

392.title: IndiGo staff member was rude, used arrogant & threatening tone with us: Pooja Hegde
392.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde took to Twitter on Thursday to share her experience with a staff member of IndiGo airline. "Extremely sad with how rude @IndiGo6E staff member, by the name of Vipul Nakashe behaved with us today on our flight out from Mumbai," she wrote. "Absolutely arrogant, ignorant and threatening tone used with us for no reason," Pooja added.

393.title: Madhavan, Nambi Narayanan meet Sunita Williams as they promote Rocketry in USA
393.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, who is promoting his directorial debut project Rocketry: The Nambi Effect, recently met astronaut Sunita Williams in the USA. The actor is on a 12-day promotional tour in US, after his visit to Cannes 2022. Former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan, on whose life the film has been made, also joined Madhavan as they visited Stafford, Texas recently.

394.title: Nearly 70 arrested for smuggling liquor from Delhi to UP since April 1
394.article_body: Nearly 70 people have been arrested for smuggling liquor from Delhi to Uttar Pradesh since April 1 due to heavy discounts on liquor purchases in Delhi, an excise official said. Excise officials have seized over 10,000 litres of illicit liquor and impounded over 20 vehicles. "The activity dents UP's revenue earnings," said Gautam Buddha Nagar's Excise Officer RB Singh.

395.title: When I talk, 25 BJP leaders bark like Mudhol dogs: Siddaramaiah
395.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah sparked a controversy when he compared BJP leaders to Mudhol (hound) dogs. "When I talk individually, 25 people from BJP start barking against me like Mudhol dogs. But when they bark, only I have to speak, no one else from our party speaks," he said, speaking at an event in Mysuru on Wednesday.

396.title: 3 history-sheeters held for attacking police with knife in Mumbai
396.article_body: Three history-sheeters were arrested for allegedly attacking two policemen with a knife when they tried to prevent a vehicle theft in Mumbai's Vikhroli, an official said. The constables were attacked by two bike-borne men when they tried to intercept the stolen vehicle. The accused were arrested within 12 hours of the attack, the official said.

397.title: Govt officer's house in Guj robbed, 2 held hostage at gunpoint
397.article_body: Three men broke into a government official's house in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Wednesday afternoon, held her house help and maid hostage at gunpoint and escaped with cash and valuables worth ₹1.6 lakh. In her complaint, Alpana Dani stated that upon returning from a parlour, she heard cries for help from her house, which was locked from the inside.

398.title: Flood sensors installed in 10 flood-prone areas in Kalyan-Dombivli
398.article_body: The Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) has installed flood sensors at 10 flood-prone locations, officials said. "These sensors will work prior to the flooding based on the level of water and then send an alert," a Smart Kalyan Dombivli Corporation Limited (SKDCL) official said. These sensors have been installed as Kalyan-Dombivli faced heavy flooding during past monsoons.

399.title: Arrest 'disastrous BJP leaders': Mamata on Prophet remarks row
399.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday reacted to the alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad by "disastrous BJP leaders", ex-party spokesperson Nupur Sharma and ex-Delhi BJP media chief Naveen Kumar Jindal, terming them as "hate speech". "I strongly seek that the accused leaders of BJP be arrested immediately so that the unity of the country isn't disturbed," she said.

400.title: Woman, 3 & 6 yr-old daughters physically assaulted in Delhi; 1 dead
400.article_body: A woman, along with her two daughters, aged three and six, were found severely beaten up at their house in Delhi's Prem Nagar on Wednesday. The six-year-old later died in a hospital, police said. An FIR under sections 307 of the IPC (attempt to murder) and 302 (murder) was filed, according to DCP (Rohini) Pranav Tayal.

401.title: Biggest protest in Pakistan's history within next few days: Imran Khan
401.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that he would finalise the date for the "biggest protest in Pakistan's history" within the next few days. "We have to go all-in for our campaign for true freedom in the next phase," he added. Following his ouster from power, Khan has been holding several rallies, demanding early elections in the country.

402.title: SRK attends Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan's wedding in Chennai, pics surface
402.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan attended his 'Jawan' co-star Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan's wedding in Chennai after recently recovering from COVID-19. The actor's manager Pooja Dadlani shared pictures of him at the wedding venue on her Instagram profile on Thursday morning and captioned it, "For Nayanthara's Special Day." Filmmaker Atlee also shared a picture of himself with Shah Rukh and his manager.

403.title: 10,000 people stuck in Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk: Mayor amid war
403.article_body: Amid ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, Sievierodonetsk's Mayor Oleksandr Stryuk said on Thursday that it's impossible to evacuate people from the city, adding that about 10,000 civilians are stuck there. Stryuk, however, stated that Ukrainian forces still control industrial zone and adjacent areas. Russian military has focused its offensive in Sievierodonetsk, which is a part of Donbas region.

404.title: Won’t be intimidated by these tactics: Owaisi on Delhi Police’s FIR
404.article_body: After Delhi Police named AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks, Owaisi said FIR doesn’t specify his crime. "We'll not be intimidated by these tactics. Criticising hate speech and giving hate speeches cannot be equated," Owaisi added. "I don’t know which specific remarks of mine have attracted FIR," Owaisi stated.
